title: On the Z3 Compact that's easy, but on the Galaxy S7
text:
Does hold the phone snugly, and while some people said theirs didn't come with the elastic additional phone holder web thing, mine did, even though I have no need for it. One of the legs on mine is longer than the other, and it has an odd lack of symmetry that doesn't hurt it functionally but looks a little strange, and on my galaxy S7 work phone you have to carefully mount it so that it holds between the volume buttons, and my personal Z3 Compact you have to dodge the shutter release button. On the Z3 Compact that's easy, but on the Galaxy S7, it's a bit finicky, and if you had a case that reduced the space between your volume buttons, you might be in trouble.

Holds the phone very firmly, I have it screwed to a piece of plywood I cut to fit in the dash tray in my F-250 and it's extremely good at holding the phone right where I want it. Kinda wish it used my old phone holder's three-point mount, though.

title: It looks pretty nice for a cheap band
text: In the world of Apple watch, there are so many options for a band. I decided to go with this one because I needed something a little more formal looking than the sport band. I do not like wearing tennis shoes to the office, and that sport band felt like a snazzy pair of New Balances. This band is quite cheap, both in price and in material. Still, it looks nice, and it fits the watch correctly. I don't know that I would give this as a gift, because the presentation box is not that nice, and your recipient would probably know it's a cheap band. This is great, though, if you are just trying to give your own watch some options without paying through the nose for name brand bands.

title: Poor instructions, weak adhesive.
text:
The instructions included in the package are unclear, with spelling and formatting errors. They do not reference all of the pieces inside the box, and give you the feeling that whoever packed the box didn't talk to the person writing the English translation.

The product itself is poor. While it goes on the phone well, and lines up to the speaker and home button openings, it does not adhere well. Even after being applied, there is a visible gap around the entire glass cover where the iPhone's surface curves. The package indicates "Weak-glue", and I agree it is weak.

EDIT 2018-04-12: After being contacted by email four times by KINGBACK, they told me:
"I am concerned whether you have received our email.We are so sorry that our product
iPhone 6 plus screen protector not work for your need.I apologise for your inconvenience.
Due to the rounded design of the iPhone 6 Plus / 6s Plus and to enhance compatibility
with most cases, the ballistic glass does not cover the entire screen.I am so sorry we
didn't make it clear in the description.
We will value the package issue and feed back your opinion to the production
department.About "Weak-glue",it mean the glue wouldn't hurt the phone screen and hand.
Would you like a replacement to be sent to you? If you insist on a refund,please let me
know.We can make a full refund to you.You don't need to return the defective one,
Can you accept that?Any problems, please email me at any time, I will try my best to
help you.Hope you can consider it and give us a reply.
Regards,
KINGBACK"

I am glad they are forthcoming with reaching out to customers, and offering refunds when not satisfied. I did not take the refund, and I did not change my rating. It's a good sign though that you can try this without much risk, as they should be willing to refund if you are not satisfied.

EDIT 2018-04-17: KINGBACK issued a refund of the entire purchase price to me, which I did not request, but I do appreciate. It is good to see that KINGBACK is interested in customer satisfaction, and went to the effort of making things right when I was not satisfied with the product.

title: OK for a Short Duration - Don't Expect it to Last
text:
This wireless car phone charger & holder was good for about 6 months. After a month or so, I noticed that I'd come back to my car, parked under the Florida sun, and the charger arms would be loose, requiring me to tighten the knobs before I could put my phone back in the cradle without the whole apparatus falling into the dashboard. By 6 months in, the product was no longer usable. I couldn't tighten or even glue the charging base to the phone receptacle. I trashed it.

As far as suction, it remained attached to my black dashboard on all but the hottest days most of the time. However, there were mornings when I found it on the floor of the car in my garage.

title: Can't Charge Phone thru Bumper
text:
1. None of my charger cables allow my phone with this bumper on it.
2. The protective dges do not protect the rear camera.
3. The design makes it easy to lose the 4 very tiny screws (tho you need only remove 1 to install the bumper).

title: Minimal Protection...
text:
The Photive bumper provides the minimal protection needed to protect you iPhone 5 from most falls, drops, etc. However, the Lightning connector opening is not large enough for the Apple 30-pin adapter -- you need to use the 30-pin to Lightning cable instead. I like it, but the bottom cracked after 10+ uses where I forced the bumper wide enough to accept the Apple 30-pin adapter. I may order another IF I can find a molded 30-pin to Lightning cable. I'm finished with the non-molded cables. I have a pre-order for the molded Lightning cable from Comprehensive!

UPDATE: As it turns out, the "molded" cable from Comprehensive Cable is not molded and not Apple-certified. It appeared to work at first but then stops; there is a warning from Apple in iOS 7 stating that the product is not certified. DOES ANYONE MAKE AN APPLE-CERTIFIED *** MOLDED **** LIGHTNING CABLE? I did order another bumper from Photive and am using it successfully with Apple's 30-pin to Lightning adapter cable.

title: Nice Bumper...Not Compatible w/ 30-pin Adapter
text:
The bumper appears to do an excellent job protecting the iPhone 5, but there are two issues I have with it. First, it doesn't work with the 30-pin to Lightning adapter. I was able to cut-out the plastic between the Lightning cable opening and the speaker openings in the bottom of the bumper case to remedy the problem, but it does take a bit of care. The second issue relates to quality of construction; the soft, rubbery material on the top of the bumper came loose after removing the phone from it 4-5 times (in order to plug in the 30-pin adapter in my vehicle).

That said, I really do like this style of protector. It gives direct access to the screen and doesn't trap moisture between the back phone cover and the protector like the clear Incase product does. I'm going to look for another product like this one that will also allow use of the 30-pin adapter and is a little more sturdy. If I had modified the bumper before using it, it might not have had the other problem I experienced. I may order another if I can't find something better and see how it performs after doing the mod first...

title: * UPDATE * - Amazon has made things right!. Always buy items "Fulfilled By Amazon"!
text:
* UPDATE * - Amazon has made things right! Always buy items "Fulfilled By Amazon"! They will take care of you.

BUYER BEWARE - This is not simply a NEW unlocked LG phone...this is an unlocked AT&T LG phone! The AT&T logo is right on the case and you will find out it is AT&T through and through as you navigate pages. I am going to discuss with Amazon if the description isn't fully truthful. New? Not so sure. Box taped up before then tape ripped off. No user's manual. Sticker slapped over technical info pre-printed on box.
Now on to the phone - switched from Verizon to Consumer Cellular. I was told by seller and CC that I might lose higher functions. Functions I lost were internet access and mobile email. I can live without. . Still would have liked seeing factory fresh packaging when NEW. Take note of what I did not. I was used to a 5 line keypad and did not realize. This is a 4 line phone. I did not pay close enough attention. This has no dedicated number line. Numbers on this phone are an "ALT +" function. I miss the number line. Numbers are in a dark blue field on the shared keys. Impossible to see in lower light. Keypad backlighting fades out quickly. Have not yet found a setting to fix this. Also, you had better be a fast dialer...lack of input of more than a few seconds will black out the display. Yes, I know...only $50. But it is $50 I would like to have back to buy a better phone. Threw away all the packaging so return is not an option.
Porting my number from Verizon to CC no problem. My generous Consumer Cellular Plan is $17.50/mo. with no contract. They simply did not offer a keypad phone in their lineup. If you can live without the features I mentioned by going to anyone but AT&T, go for it. If I could get I would give the phone itself a "C-" grade. Thanks, Todd

title: Just what was needed!
text: Have an iPad latest generation, 2nd generation, released on 2020?, and have an iMac purchased back in 2016. Found out soon enough that the cables provided with the new iPad Pro did not worked with my hub connected to my iMac. As a matter of fact the cable also did not work with iPhone 11 Pro Max, different cables, unlike older versions where one cable did work with either. In order to be able synch the iPad Pro I needed an adapter to connect the newer cable to the older USB, and this USB Female to USB Male Adapter 2 Pack, Type C to A Charger Cable (what a long winded title) worked with zero problems. Willing to bet it would also work with the iPhone mentioned above. Very happy with the purchase, as I am not very savvy overall, but thanks to a fellow reviewer that mentioned a similar case, I got it. Looks and feels sturdy, simple and functional. Was able to connect to iMac flawlessly. 5 Stars.

title: Made for each other
text:
Over the years I have come to appreciate Belkin products, and this Belkin Classic Case/Folio for IPhone 6 Plus (Blacktop) is certainly no exception. It is a sleek case that actually looks very nice, and once the IPhone 6 Plus and the case is closed again, one can tell right away how well designed it is. The easy way it turns into a stand is also very ingenious and helpful, for there are times that hands free viewing is needed. The lining inside prevents any scratches to the IPhone 6 Plus, and the magnetic closure works like a charm.
I actually feel that the IPhone while in this sleek enclosure if perfectly safe from harm, and for some this may be a very good option if they want to maintain their phone in its pristine form, without the added bulk of some protective cases that are being offered as we speak. My phone having recently arrived fit perfectly in this fine case. The card slot is also a welcome sight, for it is bound to come in handy while being in such good company. I prefer to have my phone in this case as an added peace of mind, specially at home where it can stand with the help of the case. Belkin has a sure winner with this product, and I am very happy and thankful to Amazon, for delivering this sleek case right to my doorsteps.
The IPhone 6 Plus with only a film protector to safeguard the screen, is such a beautiful piece of engineering that with the help of this type of case, one can enjoy its design with no problems. 4.5 Stars!

title: 4.5 Stars for this one!
text:
One thing I have to admit, right here and now: the amazon reviewers are like friends to me. Friends I probably never will see, but nevertheless they have so many times helped me out, that I have a strong respect for what they stand for. So In the same context that reviewers have shared their opinions, suggestions (like a much better bargain somewhere else that should be noted), and good knowledge of so many products, I like to send a "Heads Up" or "Red Alert" on this particular product.
Yes, these are small size flashlights but they look good. I was about to purchase this deal here at amazon, but I had heard from fellow reviewers that Costco might be selling them for less, which I knew from past experience was very possible. Woke up this morning, feeling like crap due to an all areas cold, but since I am now heavy into flashlights and lumens, I did call the store near me in SJC, CA, and fellow reviewers were correct. They have this deal, but to my surprise, with a significant difference. Instead of 200 Lumens, these babies rate at 250 Lumens. Together with the fact that they are dispensed with batteries and the price so much nicer (I am not trying to offend amazon's sensibilities-if it's possible such a giant can blink an eye due to emotions), but the end result was alarmingly delightful. Great deal for a high rated item, plus the confidence of buying from a place like that one where all returns are accepted if needed, I thought I immediately write a review and mention this.
Here they are telling me that I have went a little overboard for flashlights. After years of using a very mediocre (30 Lumens at most) flashlights, they simply stopped working. While looking for replacement I bought the following: MagLite with D batteries (131 Lumens), A pair of Life Gear (they came in two's 400 Lumens), Coast HP17? (605 Lumens very very cool), a much smaller Coast, baby of the family kind of like these Techlite's (131 Lumens), Life Gear again on sale (1000 Lumens), and now, for now, these other babies with a surprising 250 Lumens.
Yes, I been known to go compulsive when something grabs me the correct way. Now I keep eyeing, kind of see but do not own for now, at the real bad asses out there like Olight Flashlight (a particular one that sells way above $300 and has 2200 Lumens), called the Intimidator. I must be bored out of my mind but I can not get this one out of my mind, but thanks to my wallet who as of late is screaming for common sense, I have yet to pull the trigger! Who would have thought flashlights were so cool and I only started on October of 2012, What about Surefire, Fenix, etc? Come On! Give me a break, at least till the Holidays are through. Unless I buy everyone a flashlight and take possession once the novelty wears out. Can not do it.
Techlite Lumen Master 200 Lumens High-Intensity CREE XPG L.E.D. Tactical Flashlight, 3 Pack, great lights 4.5 Stars.
PS: there is another Techlite with 500 Lumens on sale at the place I mentioned above where I purchased mine (don't want to say the mane twice but this one ends with .com), until January 3? $49.99 included shipping and handling. I am almost sure I am not going to last and it will become a must have item, while everyone around me keep asking themselves: what in the world is really going with this fool and all these flashlights? Enticing for sure!

title: I love this phone
text:
So far, I love this phone!
A definite improvement from the Lumina 521. It has a great camera with flash, and a forward facing camera for selflies.
I went with Verizon and their SIM card & data package and I' am impressed by the speed pages load on their 4glte network.
Also about the phone, many new features with this Windows 8 operating system and it is very intuitive and easy to use.
My criteria was I wanted reliable, fast data transmission, a good rear camera with flash, front camera, lot's of features and above all a very good screen and the phone had to have lot's of add on memory. The 822 comes with 16 gig built in and you can add another 64 gig via SDCH memory chip. So I can save music videos to my hearts content, I'm waiting on my 64 gig chip.
The audio has been upgraded and you can even play with the equalizer. With Verizon I found I get ESPN sports and the NFL.
All in all, I really dig this new phone...

title: A very good buy
text:
I'm very happy with these blue tooth head phones. They sound great, have a very good range from your phone or other pared device, mine works about 100ft away from my phone, downstairs with several doors closed, that impressed me a bunch. I also picked this set because it comes with a very nice carry case you can clip on a belt loop. No wires to tangle up was my motivation but, it does have other cool features. If you're listening to music and get a call, you simply press answer on the headset (the multifunction button) complete your call and your music will automatically resume.
Also, the battery in my headset last's about 6 hours or more on a full charge with heavy use.

title: Bad design.
text:
It seems like Anker's power banks "falls asleep" and to wake it up I need to press a button on the side of the power bank. This is super uncomfortable. I plug a camping bulb with a switch into this power bank and turn bulb switch on and bulb doesn't initially turn on. Then I press power bank switch on then press bulb switch on, then bulb turns on. Then I turn the bulb switch off and when I try to turn it on in half an hour, it doesn't work.

It defeats the purpose of the bulb switch. Also, when the bulb runs for a while, power bank turns it off itself and I have to repeat the whole process. Such a bad design.

Cheaper power banks do a better job than Anker.

title: Stopped working in two to three weeks of daily use
text:
It worked ok first time I used it. Later on it started acting up.

Full sun, direct exposure: when two power banks are charged from this solar panel it actually discharges one power bank and hardly charges another one. Same issue with power bank and a phone attached simultaneously. It discharges the phone while not charging the power bank. Why does it have three outputs then? Disappointing.

Update: after two weeks charging degrated charply. After three weeks it completely stopped charging. Indicator light is not on on full sun. Checked the same power bank, same cables with an older solar panel and it works. This panel isn't working anymore.

text:
This is the second phone of this model I have got from Amazon in past year. First one wAs Las February for my daughter on a net10 plan. It's fantastic. This phone worked great just long enough to get most of the stuff off the POS iPhone. Took it off the charger at 6am...100%. used 10-15 minutes stuck in pocket and drove for an hour. Checked it another 90 minutes later about 9am ....49%. excuse me.... This makes iPhone crappy battery life look super! Charge time: ALL NIGHT. THERE IS NO 15 MINUTE QUICK CHARGE FOR 6 HOURS OF LIFE.

THIS IS CLEARKT A DUD! AND IT SUCKS BECAUSE I LEAVE FIR CANADA And ALaska for 6 weeks in less than 2 weeks.

Buy with caution! Put this thru the paces hard during return period. Let the battery discharge and recharge. Run movies, songs, games. I've had this less than a week and noticed over memorial day weekend battery progressively getting worse...AND FAST!

title: Worked for roughly five hours
text: I got this to replace my old cell phone after it finally gave up. The features looked promising enough for me to order it. After I got it all set up, I was able to mess around on Facebook, play one game, and text a few people. Then, it froze. OK no problem, reboot the phone. It started this endless circle of shutting down and starting back up for about 30 minutes. Finally get back in to where I could do something, or so I thought. Tried to send a text...frozen, again. Reboot the phone again and start the endless circle of the reboot process. Start a factory reset after finally getting back in.  set the phone back up and get to the home screen of saying who I am and linking my Google account. Guess what happened. You guessed it, frozen. Another viscous reboot cycle and factory reset yada yada yada, frozen. It was by about the 3rd factory reset and still frozen that the return was started not even having the phone for 24 hours.

title: A Little Disappointed
text:
Like a previous reviewer noted (with pictures, thank you) my screen protector has a "halo" about 1/8th of an inch wide all the way around the border. It doesn't impede the operation of the phone. I'm sure I'll get used to it and probably not even notice it after a while, but its disappointing to put a brand new screen protector on a brand new phone and not have it adhere perfectly.
Kudos to the company though on supplying not only 3 screen protectors in this kit, but also the mounting guide/frame so that the screen protector aligns correctly with the phone's screen, as well as 3 sets of wet wipes, drying wipes, dust magnets, etc. It's a very well thought-out package at a very reasonable price.

title: Updated review** still sucks!!! Went on perfect and shortly thereafter was worthless : /
text:
This held up for approximately 2.5 days : / it was easy to install and looked fabulous! But it started to peel up in a corner and by the second day it was getting progressive worse. Half the protector is up now(it folded up and rubbed on my shirt and collected lint as well!). I do have the second one to use but if I have the same results I will have spent the $8 for less than a week of usage!!! I honestly believe that the reason this product has such high ratings is because it gave out promo codes for free/discounted products in order to boost positive reviews. Look for a better option or be sadly disappointed!

Update- my husband put the second screen protector on after I went to bed last night. Woke up and again it looked perfect. It has now been 8 hours and the entire thing just fell off!!!! I have done nothing today except cook breakfast and wash a couple of load of laundry. This is beyond ridiculous! Please save your money!!!

text: I was surprised to find a 10 port charger at this low price.  I wanted small as I could get and this thing is tiny, but appears very well build.  My only minor complaint is that it did not have any rubber no slip feet on the bottom to keep it from moving around.  Luckily I had some feet that worked perfectly in my supplies. title: Super Nice
text: These review is for the 4 port unit.  It is very compact and well built.  You can tell that just by the weight.  The front section folds down to access the USB ports.  When the front is down it becomes a cell phone stand.  Very clever.  I plan to use it as a phone stand full time.  At first I was disappointed that the unit slid around, then I discovered that there was a protective film on the bottom.  Removing that exposed the gripping anti-slip surface.  To be honest I don't know how something this nice can be sold for such a low price.  I am one happy customer.....

title: All metal, sturdy phone holder for Jeep Jk
text: First off, mine is 2016 JKU, so I think this phone holder/mount should fit at least 12-18 Jeep Wrangler. I'm doing a budget build, and don't wanna spend too much money on big brand accessories like the 67 and billet, happened to find this set when browsing. It came surprisingly good, although no installation instructions, but relatively straightforward as my pictures showed. All components are metal, very sturdy but not overly heavy. It's better to have the factory 7 mm radio bracket to hold it securely. However I don't have it as my aftermarket head unit is not compatible with the bracket, so I have to use some gorilla tape to secure it. The phone mount holds up to 3/4” thick phone no problem. Mine is iPhone 13 with OtterBox. You can also hang the hand held radio and even a CB on the side bracket. I'm using midland 275. Make sure to tighten down all the bolts after installation

title: Flexible and secure mounting options
text: Most of car phone holder clamp on the AC vent and they block the cold air in summer and get the phone too hot in winter, which I don't like. I switched to this product because there are multiple ways to securely mount the holder, and the suction cup can rotate to get the best angle you want. Most importantly, it comes with two supporting points, one being the main suction cup and the other being the small clip support. In this way, the phone can be firmly supported and less likely fall off because the suction fails as the force is distributed between the two supporting points.

title: Compatible with all screen protectors
text: I like the recession design a lot as it massively reduces the chance of scratching your Apple Watch. And because of this, it's fully compatible with most of screen protector, or film I'd rather say. I tried a few different Apple Watch protectors and over time due to the tight fit, they chip off the screen protector. But this elkson one has the raised edge and won't interfere with the screen protector at all.

title: Adjustable height, easy folding up, sturdy and anti slippery phone/pad stand
text: Made of high density composite material and some metal, very sturdy. The rubber feet, backing pad and lip liner make sure it's not easy to knock off and hold ipad w/o any problem. I really like the idea of adjustable height and it's very easy to fold up into a size of an iPhone, quite portable

title: My iPhone X fits firmly
text: I like this design that I can just drop my phone on the lower feet and automatically pull the upper feet to grab the phone tight. The upper rubber feet provide a lot friction and the phone is on quite firmly. Also the phone won't interfere the volume button at all. I have a ring holder in back, so the thickness could be a problem. What I did is pull out the rubber feet a little bit so the depth is enough to hold the phone.

title: Leave it in the car dash and let the Sun do the job
text: Instead of charging the power bank every couple of days, why not just use the sun shine. I leave this solar power bank on dash when I park my car in the morning, and pretty much fully charged. It can charge my iPhone 8 about 3-4 times, and I'm pretty happy with it.

title: GREAT PHONE AND GREAT SERVICE...
text:
Hi.. I normally never write a review for any phone.. I like to enjoy reading reviews... but I couldn't help myself form writing a review for this phone... First of all.. this is a superb phone.. awwsome phone whatever you want call good for it.. this phone rocks .. blah ... blah .. and if you know how make things work, this phone is really gr8 than any other phone in the market till today.

1) This phone looks gr8.. Very slick .. light weight and battery life is good ... (it comes with a spare battery for people who want to use internet 24 hours on this phone...)

2) yahoo... gmail and company emails works really awwsome...

3) yahoo, msn and aol messenger works like a champ...

4) Internet like google maps works gr8... I heard someone said it doesn't work.. but sorry to say that buddy it works..

I know I know.. You wanted to know how to make these things works.

First of all this phone only comes with cingular so.. you need to have cingular or need to switch to cingular...

Then sign up for any plan which suites your needs for voice call...

But heres is tricky part... You can get max 200 message bundle from cingular which cost only 19.99 for a month... which is gr8.. since comes with 200 any types of messages like SMS(Normal text messages) , IM (yahoo msn and aol chat.) and MMS (picture and video messages) .. I know this is really small no for people who use chatting all the time..

But good part is it also comes with unlimited media net uses which you can use to check email and browse internet.. get driving directions...

etc...

Once you have enable this feature on you phone.. All you need to do is..

Install IM's using preinstall installer for OZ for all three IM...

Then install yahoo go to check yahoo mails.. and all other yahoo features...

Then tricky part is google.. You can setup google mail pop account .. on the phone.. you can find instruction of there pop and smtp servers information... anywhere on the web.. But before you do that you need to enable pop for all messages or messages from now onwards from setting in gmail account... otherwise gmail will keep asking you for your password on your smartphone.. samsung I607... blackjack..

And for you company emails you need information for your company exchange server...

If you have any problems and would like to get help setting these things on your phone.. please do some googleing before you contact me.. But if you don't get it.. don't worry.. Email me and i will help you...

Hope you enjoy this awwsome phone...

These are some tricks for this phone.. like if you hold home key.. it will take you to task manager like on any other windows OS you select run and then enter taskmgr and enter.. or after ctrl+ alt + delete and then task manager..

Also there is code to enter into admin part of this phone.. you can find instruction on internet...

title: sturdy, well made cell phone cover
text: There is a very limit selection of cell phone covers for the G8 ThinQ.  I purchased 3 different ones (spigen tough armor, vinve carbon fiber and this ghostek one), because we have multiple G8 phones.  5 stars for sturdiness, 5 stars for durability, 5 stars for not being slippery.  This cover is well made and probably the sturdiest of the 3 we purchased, and not slippery.  It will protect the phone if it drops on the sides or back.  It is thicker than I expected, yet wished that it protected the glass screen a little better.  LG screens are very sensitive, so if you buy this case, I would recommend purchasing a glass screen protector.  So 4 stars for protecting the screen.  I think the spigen case will protect the screen better.  4.5 stars for ease of finding side buttons, and the ability of pushing the buttons.  The spigen case buttons are not as good (flushed to the phone).  Wished that the corner bumper guards were not red, I think it looks odd, and would look nicer if it was the same color as the case.  Wished that it wasnt so bulky looking, as it is much bigger than my other case and makes the phone look larger than it is.  Overall, it is a good phone case, and I would recommend if you are looking for a sturdy, durable case, and dont mind the bulk and red corners.

title: Good for movies/videos...but not the best for gaming.
text:
I have been playing around with VR for a long time now, right from Oculus rift to Google Cardboard. It is valuable to understand that if you're looking at this product, you're probably looking for something similar to Google Cardboard which is not an actual cardboard and not something like Oculus or Hololens. This is a good product for beginners that want to start playing around with VR apps on their phones and a great products that want to watch movies and videos on it. That being said, I don't think this is the best product over all.
Before I get into Pros and Cons, let's begin with the shipping and packaging. The product arrived seamlessly, on time. The packaging was good, meaning it was not damaged, the content packaged as promised by the seller were present and worked fine. I have used it for over a week now and the following is what I think about the True Depth VR Viewer for Smartphones.

PROS:
- Good fit. Adjustable straps.
- Adjustable holder for smartphones which allows iPhone 5 and iPhone 6. For Android, any phone comparable to the iPhone in size.
- Adjustable viewer width for people of all head sizes (meaning thinner or wider space between eyes).
- Padding makes it comfortable for the face.
- Camera can be used by taking the back cover off for Augmented Reality apps.
- Earphones can be used while using this

CONS:
- Can't focus. Although the lenses can be rotated and that is suppose to adjust the focus, it didn't work for me.
- Nose space is not padded and can get uncomfortable for some.
- No QR code and hence no Google Cardboard apps can be used.
- Not immersive, which makes it good for movies and videos but not for many gaming apps.

Over all, I would repeat, its great from watching movies and videos but not the best for playing games. The attached photos would give a good idea of how it looks.
Although I was given this product for free, my review is absolutely honest and unbiased.

title: Slow charging + unsolicited mailing
text:
When I first received this in the mail it arrived broken. The plastic stem attaching it to the base was snapped. A replacement was quickly provided without hassle - great.

What I dislike - it does not charge my Apple Watch overnight. I don't think this is acceptable. 7 hours to charge a small device and it can't do do it? The original charger can do it in about 30 minutes. Last night I put it on the charger at 58%, and took it off the charger 7 hours later and it was at 89%.

I have to fish around for where to position my ear buds on the charging pad to get it aligned in order to get it to charge - some sort of circle or dot for where to align would be helpful.

I also received an unsolicited postcard in the mail offering to pay me $25 if I left a 5 star review for my purchase. Those reading the reviews should consider this when reading the reviews.

Things I like - the charger is aesthetically pleasing. It looks cute and there are fewer cables cluttering my bedside table. That's it.

title: ** UPDATE **Folding prongs bad design
text:
See update below review:

Looks can be deceiving. The ANKER USB-C 25W PD Fast Wall Charger looks well designed and sturdy, but the smallest error in calculations or the manufacturing process going awry can destroy the best of intentions.

It was about a month after receiving the charger that I started to have issues with it working. I started to send it back then (about 6 weeks ago) , however my past experience with Anker products being reliable, at a lower price point than top of the line of electrical/electronic products and not wanting to go through the return process had me hesitate. Now it is acting up again on a more regular basis.

The problem is that the folding of the outlet prongs don't stay set internally and the prongs fold just enough to lose contact inside the unit and then it stops charging. I have jiggled and fiddled with putting up with it for too long now. I don't feel that sending back an electrical product after using it this long is proper.

However, I did see that even though the return window had closed, there was product support for 90 days and it was within this parameter. So I chatted with an Amazon support bot and finally had to request a call back. The Amazon live agent did a good will return on this. Not sure I should have used a 'good will' credit for such a low priced item, but I did.

All in all I would not recommend this charger. In the future I think I will try not to get a charger with folding prongs for travel. I have plenty of these that still work and the chance of them not being made correctly and thus not working is multipled over a simple normal stationary prong.
*** UPDATE JAN 13 2023 ***
Anker saw the review that I did on this charger and the problem with the folding prongs that were defective and not allowing electricity to flow through to the charger. They reached out to me and asked if I would like a refund or replacement. This was done quite a while past any normal return period. They say that they guarantee most of their products for 18 months (I think I have this correct) but I was surprised to get such a message for an electronic product. I accepted the full refund as I had already purchased another charger without folding prongs. Kudos to Anker for such a responsible, caring attitude!!

title: Highly recommend! Great quality. Can charge many things at one time.
text:
Love this! I've had it for a few months and so far so good. I haven't had any issues with it. I like how it fits into my cup holder. It makes it easier to access and to use then other multi charges I have owned in the past. I had no where to put my other ones, They kinda just was placed on my seat or on the floor which was really annoying. Only downfall is that I lose a cup holder, especially if my passenger has a drink but it's worth it.

I use this to charge my dash cam, cellphone and GPS, all at the same time. The dash cam has to be plugged in all the time for it to work so I end up losing my cigs outlet and can't charge anything else. We all know a GPS battery life isn't long either. So this is very useful and affordable.
I like how the part that goes into the cig lighter has usb outlets too. I've also used this for a portable air pump to blow up my fishing raft. This charger definitely has enough power to charge everything all at one time.

title: I've Always loved life proof
text:
I've Always loved life proof. Great product. Been buying them for the last 10 years. But everything gets normal wear and tear like the thumb print or the volume button will break off. If anything happens to the case then you can contact life proof and they will replace the case for free. You just pay shipping. I've never damaged my iphones with these cases. My phone is always protected 100%.
Over the years I've read complaints that people can't hear with the case on or it's muffled. I've been fortunate enough to not have this happen with any of my cases. ( hopefully I won't jinx myself!)
My only complaint Is the cost! $30-$80 for a piece of plastic and rubber when it cost them pennies to make. However having an iPhone is an expensive investment so you want to make sure it's protected. I've never semerged my phone in water or brought it into the pool or ocean to take pictures. I wouldn't trust any case to take that risk. But it does protect my phone from falling and never had a cracked screen or a messed up phone. This particular case I bought for my iPhone 7. It fits like it's suppped to.

title: Will buy again for new phone cases. Held up pretty good. No complaints
text:
Worked great but I don't recommend trying to
re stick it more then twice as it won't stick all that good. Held up though. And doesn't leave a sticky residue on the case. I Will buy more for when I change my iPhone cases. This is much better then those poppers ( in my opinion) bc it has a loop for your finger so you can grasp it better and it stands up great when resting it on a table to watch something on my phone. The weight of your phone will not make it fall. ( I have an iPhone 7, but should withhold the weight of the plus) I recommend.

title: Has potential if seller would change a few flaws in the design. But not for me at this time.
text:
Bought for an iPhone 7. I'm not a fan of this case. There's some flaws. These may bother some people, depending on how picky you are. It looks and feels sturdy and it should Protect your phone. However I just got it today and I don't like a few things so I can't say how long it will hold up for. I don't have any issues texting like some other reviewers had, it fits fine, and is completely covered, just like it should be. When making phone calls, people can hear me just fine and I can hear my music fine too. What I don't like is the fact that my chargers won't fit thru the case. And the design is a little weird where the volume button is to it change vibrate/ring. I feel like this could cause the actual button on the phone to snap off. Not worth the risk of breaking an $700 phone or having to buy new chargers. I have probably 10 different ones, but the10ft charger, the one I use the most, doesn't fit. I paid $30 for it and I'm not buying another kind to see if it fits either. I decided to return this for a refund and bought a life proof instead for $12 more. Life proof is what I've been using for years. Every time I buy another brand, I always go back to it. Spend the extra money on a better case. iPhones aren't cheap. They're an investment lol
If this company would fix these flaws, then maybe I'd try them again in the future. This product has potential. I will say it's hard to get off the case. You'll need to use the things they send with it or a butter knife to get it off. So at least we know it's secure on our phones. But not worth those risks like I mentioned.

title: It's great! Almost as good as life proof cases but a lot slimmer.
text:
This case is really great! Almost as great as life proof cases but much cheaper!
When I bought this I didn't realize it was for the iPhone 8. I have the 7, however it fits! It's designed the same way! I was happy I didn't have to return it.
It's very slim, not bulky at all. You can change the back plates to 3 different colors. Which is awesome. I hate having just an all black case because I lose it all the time bc it blends in with my car seats and anything else black that I have. I love how it has the thumbprint plastic/rubber piece. I like it bc it protects your phone better. Everything is basically covered except for the camera and flash. I wish that was designed to be covered. Also the flap to turn your phone on silent or ringtone, that can be tough to switch if you don't have long nails. But a pen or paper clip will work fine, or just your finger.
Other reviews complained that people couldn't hear them talk clearly, I haven't had that issue. As soon as I put it on I made a call to check. Everyone I've talked to since I put this on has no issues hearing me. I don't have any issues either. Maybe they redesigned it since then? Or they got a dud? This also was very easy to put on my phone. All in all, I'm very happy with my purchase. I recommend it. You can't beat the price. As long as the price stays low, I will buy from them again in the future for my nieces phones. I'm thinking Xmas gifts! :)

title: I had my doubts, but I was wrong
text:
I had my doubts, first about the size, then about the power of this particular wall charger.

As soon as I received it, I unwrapped it and plugged it into a power strip that I have behind my monitors on my desk. I wanted to be able to check it during the day as the last one I purchased like this began to get hot and eventually stopped charging. So far, since yesterday mid-day, it has charged my two iPhones and my Kindle with absolutely no problem, and the unit is not getting hot.

My only concern, because it seems to be fine on all counts, is that the actual plastic covering the charger feels thin, if that word can be used to describe it. Not that it is broken or cracked or anything like that. The charger is a bit lighter weight than I expected and the plastic has to be a contributor to that weight.

I'm giving this five stars, as it checked off every box, is working fine, is not heating up, and has charged 3 items simultaneously and quickly.

title: Nice, sturdy case
text:
When I started carrying an I-phone for work, I wanted a case that could withstand the beating I knew the phone was going to take. The case needed to fit tightly on the phone and be thick enough, padded enough, that if I dropped the phone, it would survive. And it also needed to be some color that looked adult. I didn't need the phone case to scream teenager nor did I need cartoons, so I went through this site looking for something that would fit into the narrow parameters I set. When I found this one, I was very pleased. And even more pleased when it arrived. I've dropped the phone twice and both times the case protected it. The case does not block even one function of the phone and it makes the phone quite easy to hang onto.

I would recommend.

title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY: doesn't work
text: [[VIDEOID:1f3e520f7b321994ac74454f5c1c0271]] This product doesn't really work. It takes less then a minute for it to stop working and send an error. I've had it for less then a month and only used a few times. The first couple times it worked great. Now it won't work at all.

title: Cheap, breaks easy
text:
This case is cheap! Only had it about a month and the whole side broke off. Also the stand/finger holder is loose and does not stay put when put away. My phone falls over when on the kick stand. The case is loose and my phone randomly pops out of the case and the case something off if I drop my phone. That does not protect it. Don't waste your money. Pay a little more for a better case.

The screen protector they send does not fully fit the screen and the sides are left lifted which collect all kinds of dirt and and crap.

title: Awesome charger.
text: This product is awesome. I really enjoy it. It charges fast. Holds my phone. I love the electronic arms. I can still use the speaker phone, as this doesnt block my speaker like other car stands do. The only issue is sometimes the suction cup comes loose and the whole unit falls.

title: Quality made charger for Fit Bit
text: I bought this after misplacing the charger that came with the FitBit and it works perfectly!  It was very promptly shipped.  Great quality product.

title: Great screen protector!
text: I am very pleased with this screen protector.  It was easy to install and it's doing a great job keeping my screen free of cracks!  My fingerprints are still detected, and everything works great.  Great value.

title: Great quality & value!
text: I am very happy with this phone case.  A friend of mine recommended it to me because her whole family uses this one and it really protects the phone.  I love that it doesn't add a lot of bulk to the phone.  I use this with a glass screen protector and so far, so good!

title: High quality, great price!
text: I am overwhelmingly pleased with this stylus/pen! My daughter was wanting the Apple Pencil, which I was not ready to spend the money on.  She uses this pen on her iPad for filling out work sheets and other school assignments as well as digital art creations.  She was really surprised by the quality.  This was a great price for a high quality item!

title: User friendly!
text: I purchased this for my husband's commuter car which was not equipped with blue tooth.  It was very easy to set up and it works great.

title: fits perfectly and looks better
text: This looks better than advertised.

title: Not the greatest by any means...but  unfortuately, the best you're gonna get
text: The charging cord doesn't want to completely fit with the case on the phone.... The outer slipcase / pocket clip fits weirdly the phones doesn't ever want to slide in properly without a struggle. The overall design is sturdy...however the flip kickstand is cheap. You probably will not fond a better product for this phone and I find that a shame.

title: NICE CASE!  BUT ***NOT COMPATIBLE WITH MAGSAFE PRODUCTS***
text: We got this and loved it until I got a magsafe charger. With this case on it, the phone fell right off and we had to buy a case that is designed to work with magsafe products.

title: May not look as sexy as some of the other holders but it's brilliant
text:
I'm talking about the phone holder, not me, obviously :-|

This is a very well designed product. It has a well conceived clamp that will work in a wide number of circumstances you might try it in. At the moment I have it clamped to the 1.5" x 1.5" square-stock metal leg of a stand by my desk.

It is flexible enough to articulate just how you want the phone and quite stiff so it holds it where you want it. The clip for the phone is so easy to use. Easy to add and remove phone, yet it is very secure.

The ability to position the phone so precisely and arbitrarily makes this invaluable to various situations.

The only downside is that if you tap the phone it will tend to vibrate a few millimeters to each sides for a few seconds, which you can compensate for by steadying with your hand, tapping lighter or just being patient.

title: This is nice. Supreme adjustability
text:
I can put this on the night stand next to the bed and bend it to accommodate any angle my head is at on the pillow. For example, I can make the phone low and perpendicular such that the phone is as though standing upright on the bottom edge of the phone on the nightstand. Which is cool in use, but not necessarily a decorative look otherwise :-)

Having said that, it's not for every situation because it is flexible but not super stiff so it doesn't take too much force to change the alignment, but it's stable enough to stay in the position you move the phone to, all things being equal.

title: Cool thing about this is how adjustable it is and how neatly it folds up
text: For something so compact in storage, it adjusts to so many configurations. Very nice to have for various situations one might encounter.

title: Has a magnetic personality. Don't leave home without it.
text:
I didn't realize that magsafe chargers and holders require a special phone case with a properly positioned metal insert, as this case has!

We learned the hard way after my wife's ordinarysilicone case didn't stick to the nice mag charge.

But this - works - great.

It also has a nice feel.

Warm color. Rich and uplifting without being gaudy.

title: Suprisingly incredible! Spent $10 less for this superior product!
text:
So I've been pretty happy with the other product I've used a few times, that gets good reviews. Until now. I just got an iPhone 14 Pro Max and decided to take a chance on this one.

Well, their claims about flawless installation aren't hyperbole. I went to URL on the installation kit, watched the video, did it, and *flawless*. Looks fantastic. Alignment looks factory installed. Bubble and dust free, PLUS protector for camera lenses that looks great, makes them flat and smooth (instead of the 3 discrete lumps of the cameras themselves protruding) and fits perfectly and seamlessly with Apple standard iPhone 14 Pro Max leather case.

Will be buying this brand in the future.

title: Unfortunately, this product is misrepresented in the description. :-(
text:
At the time of this review, the product description says:

"NOTE: ONLY COMPATIBLE FOR iPhone 13 Pro Max. The Screen Protector, open edge design, covers the whole display, featuring maximum protection from scratches, scrapes, and bump"

I just got a new iPhone 13 Pro Max today and immediately installed the screen protector. It does NOT cover the whole screen. There is over a 1/16" gap (probably 3/32"+) between the phone edges horizontally and vertically.

It's not a great look when looking closely.

Also, while it may protect the phone mostly, it still leave some parts vulnerable and increases risk.

Now I have to try to find one that fits better. The price is great but I'd rather pay a buck or three more for one that fits properly.

Note to seller and manufacturer: Please correct the size of the glass you sell and upgrade the product and I'll buy it again. Meanwhile, I'm looking for a vendor who does it right.

title: USB-A ports do not charge Apple Watch properly
text:
It is doesn't work like other chargers do with the Apple Watch's charging cable. The watch doesn't go into the normal clock/alarm clock mode when and doesn't cjarge unless the charger is repeatedly unplugged and replugged into the wall.

Sometimes it seems to charge and sort of work for a few minutes, but awhile later, the watch can't be contacted by tapping. Doesn't seem to be charging. None of these behaviors exist with other USB chargers. The watch is new and in perfect condition.

Don't know if it is simply a defective unit or a badly engineered product. I didn't seem to have trouble charging iPhone.Maybe this charger can't deal with the lower current draw of the watch and doesn't really switch on or does it intermittently. Almost seems like some capacitance issue too insofar as unplugging it and plugging it back in momentarily resets, but it continues reverting back to the broken behavior.

title: Looks nice. Works fine
text: Useful adapter for USB A to USB C

title: Fantastic product! Looks *GREAT* and it works. Cheap & several
text: You get 3 for a very great price! It looks like the phone's screen, smooth, and brilliant. Dropped the phone a couple of times. This screen broke but not the main screen. Easily replaced as kit comes with three. Recommend.

title: Works, unlike some similar products that won't charge through a thin silicone case, but a bit messy
text:
The good part is it works for the iPhone 11 Pro Max. If you're trying to stay organized and have something that just works and looks decent, this device is fine, particularly when all your toys are parked on it. The bad part is, there are 3 wires coming out the back, which is a mess, particularly if you can't drape them behind something that to hide them like a dresser with a solid back.

Unpleasantly, to set it up for first use, you have run the wire cables for the Apple Watch, Airpod case and iPhone through the unit, routing them through the channels in the bottom. But the wires don't stay in the channels they're supposed to sit in. They didn't put any little tabs like many similar configurations in other devices have to keep the wires from falling out, so someone would need tape or glue to ensure they don't come out when the unit moves and I think that's just not well enough designed.

Another thing I did not like: The air pod case cable's connector floats loose in the curved hollowed-out seat where the air pod case sits. So, instead of letting you just push the airpod case down onto the connector for a solid easy to insert and remove connection, you have to still plug a loose wire into your Airpod case and then snug the case and wire back down into the seat. But that's something you'd probably be doing couple of times a day, or more because airpod cases hold a charge so you can recharge your airpods on the go, so you may need to frequently take the case with you, so having that airpod connector loose and having to plug it in like a simple wired connector is kind of a tacky solution.

The last thing I don't love is that the adjustable charger back plate, which is clever in the sense that it can accommodate a lot of phones, just look great when there's no phone sitting on the stand, because it's busy, with contrasting grey and black, and shows too much of the engineering for someone looking for a more refined finished look. A charging stand more suited to one particular vendor or model of phone could have the charging coils line up without adjustment and would be a cleaner and more discreet look like the other wireless charger I have, the Seneo, which looks very good and works well with my iPhone 11 Pro Max and worked well for my iPhone Xs Max for a year.

So while this could be a fairly decent product for some people, I think it costs a bit too much particularly based on the design flaws I mentioned.

title: You just can't beat this for the price. It's perfect.
text:
This is a really nice watch-stand and saves a fortune over the Apple-branded Apple Watch stand. I bought two of these and was not disappointed. It's very solid, nice look and texture (will protect furniture), stays in place. It holds the watch at a very nice level and position giving it simple dignity compared to just setting the watch on its side on the nightstand.

With this device the Apple Watch functions perfectly as the only alarm clock I will ever need. Being stable and sturdy it makes it much quicker and easier to connect your watch for charging. So much bang for the buck

title: Useful.
text: Nice cover. Really need something like this for Sphero to grip and not get scratched up.

title: Screwy
text: It is really quite a substantial set of tiny screws of various sizes and threading.

title: Excellent replacement part.
text:
Got the part quickly, on time and in perfect condition, with its complete set of tools adequate to do the job. It installed perfectly and works excellently. The phone looks flawless; brand new, without a doubt. The LCD display, digitizer pad, speaker, home screen button and touch id sensor (all parts involved in the replacement job) are all functioning perfectly after the replacement.

I used the 11 minute YouTube video by "JerryRigEverything"' as a guideline for doing the repair. Note: This particular LCD/digitizer unit does not have a metal backing piece, so, along with the TouchID/Home Button and speaker, needs to be transferred from the phone to the replacement assembly. Moving the metal backing is easy enough. Just 4 small screws on the side, as alluded in the video (which mentions *some* replacement units require this extra step), and a 5th screw on an adjacent part.

Be warned, while replacing the LCD/digitizer not for the feint of heart, particularly for a first time DIYer. To do this right, you need to be steady, focused, good with your hands, and have attention to fine detail. You may feel like a brain surgeon at times. It helps to have mechanical and electronics familiarity or some hobby or background requiring similar levels of detail oriented acuity. All the connectors in the 5S are extremely delicate and the screws extremely tiny, and challenging to work with, in a cramped area, with several challenging access points. It would be all too easy to botch the job, ruin a flex cable, or a connector, or misalign something, or fail to re-attach a connector properly, lose screws, or mix them up (they are small but different sizes), put a cable or assembly bracket or cover on backwards, etc.... and wind up with a non-working phone. So keep very close track of the order and position of everything you do by any means necessary to you can get it back together perfectly.

title: As described
text: Fits my new 11 pro perfect and looks red and sparkly just like the picture

title: This stand does not just fall over!
