title: Five Stars
text: Arrived quickly and works well.

title: Works well
text: The charger works well and is exactly as expected. The only reason I subtracted one star is because it seems like the USB cords have to be plugged in upside down in order to plug in to the charger. Not a big deal, just slightly frustrating as it hasn't become natural yet to turn the cords upside down before plugging them in.

title: Protects phone, just as pictured
text: Exactly as pictured. It has protected my screen from cracking several times when I have dropped my phone. My only complaint is that the clear frame gets dyed from putting the phone in pockets and doesn't remain clear.

title: Work perfectly for Toyota Prius key fob
text: This battery works perfectly for the Toyota Prius key fob and saves us time and money from having to go to the dealership.

title: Very bright/bold gold streaks to marble design
text: The gold in the design stands out so much that it looks obnoxious. I don't think the website accurately reflects the brightness of the gold streaks. While I recognize others might like this, it was too bold for me.

title: Great soft, slim case
text: Great case. I especially like that it isn't hard. It's soft, slim, not clunky, and seems to provide good protection. My only hesitations are that it is somewhat slippery in the sense that I sometimes worry about dropping it, and because of the case material, lint (from a pocket) tends to stick to it. All in all though, great case; I would definitely recommend it.

title: Keep scrolling.
text: Usually, small electronic devices arrive partially charged, and you can check them out, confirm it's going to do what you want, and that it's in good (brand new) working condition. Not this one. It didn't turn on, and even when plugged in and charging, not a single indicator light came on. It's a HUGE hassle to return stuff, since I live in a rural area, but eventually, this waste of my time and money will be returned.

title: Weak magnet
text: The phone charger works well enough, but does heat up my phone to a rather alarming temp sometimes; it does have a very secure hold. The watch charger arm unfortunately, barely holds the watch, and spends the night lighting up and  restarting the charging process over and over. Sadly, the return window is closed, and I'm going to have to replace it.

title: Fingerprints everywhere!
text:
I liked the “soap bubble” look online, but in person it just doesn't look nice. It completely obscures the pretty ‘sierra blue' of my phone, and makes it look pink, with a weird geometric pattern.

I could probably live with that, as it does seem like a case that would protect my phone from damage, but it has a very wide cutout for the camera lenses, with squared, rather than rounded edges. Aside from the fact that my mild ocd can't tolerate it, it also leaves space for dust and whatever to get into the case, and scratch my phone.

And ohhhh the fingerprints! I've gotten used to most things having an anti-fingerprint coating that minimizes the smudged look. Turns out, that's become important to me. I'm not a fan of the smudges.

All that aside, it's definitely functional as a MagSafe case. It has no trouble at all sticking to the charger.

Buyer beware though… you can return it, as I am doing, but you have to print a label and package it, with its RMA. You won't be able to just drop it at ups for them to pack it.

title: Cheap metal beads will turn your wrist black
text:
I like this band. It looks nice, but isn't flashy. It fits well, feels like it'll stay snug on my wrist for a long time before the elastic begins to weaken… and I thought that the cheap metal was too small an amount to cause color changes on my wrist, but I was wrong.

If I wear it, it's only for a 3 hour or less period of time, (running errands, or to a short appointment) to keep from having what appear to be blackish-green bruises appear around my wrist.

If I find one from the same seller/brand without metal, I'll consider buying it, but I'll never buy another of this design.

title: It does “yellow”….
text:
and it did not take long to get started turning yellow. I've only had it 6-8 weeks.

Positives:

Fits perfectly. I do feel confident that my phone is well protected from casual impact, such as dropping from less than 4 feet, or tossing it onto an end table from a couple feet away.

Nice feel/texture. It's smooth and flexible, with a soft texture that is easy to hold, and doesn't slide off the arm of the couch the second I set it down.

Wireless charging-friendl! I have no trouble at all charging my phone with the case of, both on my home charging station, and the dash-mounted charger in my car.

Looks nice. It adds a pretty, slightly girly touch to the phone without being obnoxious.

Negative: it's already turning slightly yellow. For that reason, I'm very disappointed, and will be purchasing a different case for my phone.

title: Skip it.
text:
This is one of those chargers that requires the use of your your Apple Watch charger. Since the newer models of the Watch come with a type C charger, (the SE and Series 7) you will need a USB-c to USB adapter. What luck! There's one in the package! Once installed, you will want to plug in the USB-c charging cable into the brick (the adapter you will plug into the wall)… but wait…. You can't. They only gave you one adapter for USB-c to regular USB.

This is clearly an older model of the charger, and they're unloading the inventory on people who think they'll be able to charge all of their Apple products at once.

I returned this, after trying to pawn it off on family members who also own Apple products.

title: Like wearing sandpaper.
text:
I urge you to skip this product.

The leather, which it might actually be, is not soft, and will probably fall apart with few hours of use. The inside of the band; you know, the part against your skin... feels like sand paper. It's unfinished and not sealed with any kind of leather treatment.

The edges of the band have a distinctly sharp feel to them, and there's no way that will feel ok when my wrist is bending or turning.

Since I was looking for something comfortable enough to wear all day, and/or night, I can assure you that this watchband is not it.

The only thing left to decide is whether or not it's worth a trip to UPS in order to return it.

title: Classic and simple. Very nice!
text:
I've only had this watchband for a couple days, but so far, I love it. As long as it doesn't turn my wrist black or green, it's going to be my primary band.

The only issue I have with it, is likely a "me" problem, not a problem with the product, but it's difficult to get it snugly adjusted. Until getting an Apple watch (6), I've always worn loose, bracelet type bands, so having to keep it snug against my wrist is taking some getting used to.

I didn't like the silicone bands, the elastic, the scrunchie types. All of them have been irritating. I've also never kept a watch on overnight. So now I'm tracking my sleep patterns, and oddly enough, this metal band is the one that doesn't annoy me.

It's smooth, no rough areas, no sharp edges; it's mesh, so oxygen can circulate.

It will loosen a little through the course of the day, so I recommend checking to make sure the clasp is closed and it's tight enough to do whatever your watch is supposed to do.

I will probably buy some additional colors to suit my moods, but the silver is a classic.

title: It came just in time...
text:
In time for what; you may be asking...? It came in time for me to install the screen protector, and drop my phone down inside the couch once, knock it off the arm of the chair once, and finally, the true test: my phone was knocked off the arm of the couch by the tail of one of my Great Danes, kicked down the hall, and galloped across twice by BOTH dogs, before I could grab it.. keep in mind, while the puppy is only 100 lbs, the big boy checks in at a solid 180 lbs.

The screen protector not only didn't shatter, there's not a scratch on it.

Now, how does it fit? Pretty well. My favorite part of the design is that the screen protector isn't cut out across the bottom to accommodate the home button/fingerprint scanner. It's a full circle/hole. That means two fewer edges/points to come up off the glass, and two fewer weak spots for cracks to start.

The protector does create a significantly raised screen, above and beyond the edges of the case. (See photos. Same company, great fit for the cover.) There is a small amount of space between the edge of the glass and the edge of the case. This is only mildly annoying, and it's not enough to consider changing brands.

This item comes in the package with two screen protectors, and two of everything you need to install it. I don't usually install my own screen protectors, because my hands shake, and I have trouble aligning them. Since there's two in the box, I decided to give it a try. I think it's a little off center, but that's my fault, not the manufacturer. I was a little disappointed to find that this item didn't include an alignment tool like many others.

What it does have, is a very substantial tool to push out any air bubbles. I ended up with a lot of them. After an hour of running that thing back and forth across the air bubbles, there still wasn't a mark on the glass.

Is it designed specifically for the iPhone SE (2020 model)? Almost, but not quite. There are spots for cameras or something on the screen protector that have no corresponding function on my phone.

Overall, I'm recommending this. It seems very well made. It's considerably thicker than anything on the market recently, and I believe it really will keep my screen safe.

title: Fits well, nice texture, (now broken, see update).
text:
Update 7/1/2020
I emailed the customer service department at Torras, and though it took them 48 hours to respond, they immediately requested a mailing address, and sent out a new one. The product, I'm sticking with 4 stars. The company though, I'd give them five for good customer support, and willingness to stand by their product.

Update 6/26/20: I dropped my phone, and the case split along the seam at the bottom. My phone survived without damage, but the case is now completely useless.

These are supposed to be warrantied for 18 months. I contacted them through the customer support email on the product box, but they have not responded (36 hours). I did expect to get at least an automated reply saying they got my email and will contact me, but I've heard nothing. I hope I do hear back soon. If not, I'll go through Amazon to enforce the warranty.

I've only had the case for a couple days, (shipping was EXTREMELY slow) so I can't attest to it's longevity. What I can say, is that it fits my iPhone SE (2020 model) very well. It took a little to get it fitted into the case, but I'm absolutely confident that it will not come loose.

The color is fantastic. It's a deep, vibrant red, with a slightly metallic look. It feels soft, has some kind of non-slip coating to it.

It is very slightly raised around the camera lens, which is nice, since the new iPhone doesn't have a raised bezel to protect it. Unfortunately, this case does not offer any raised edge protection for the screen of the phone.

This case IS absolutely compatible with wireless charging.

One more downside though, which will probably not matter to the vast majority of people: I always attach some kind of handle to the back of my phones because I have trouble holding onto things. This case has a coating that prevents adherence to the cover. I've read that before about other cases, but the handles stuck anyway. Not so with this one. The handles will NOT stick to the surface of this cover.

I recommend this cover for anyone else. It's nice.. feels secure, has a nice texture, and the color is an excellent, slightly more interesting (near) match to the iphone's original color.

title: Weak
text: I know they are labeled mini, but I assumed the magnets were full strength. These just aren't strong enough to hold my phone.

title: Fits my Moto Z2 Force well, but looks dirty quickly
text:
I just purchased a second cover because the first one, no matter how often it's washed, or with what type of cleanser, it always looks dirty. Clearly it's absorbing oils from my skin. Anyway, it looked awful, so I bought another. I'm sure it will end up the same way as the first, at which point, I'll probably look for a different cover.

Fits my phone really well, color is nice, price seems a little high for the product itself.

title: Meh. Fine if you like bulky phones
text:
Functional as a cover, but VERY bulky. I yard it for about a month, but finally gave up on it.

It would have been much more comfortable to use if there were more of the silicone material where you generally hold onto it.

title: Phone is NOT UNLOCKED
text:
If this phone was unlocked as advertised, I'd give it 4 stars. Please understand, the phone you get will be the AT&T 925. Also, please note: one customer answered question was "Does this phone support WiFi calling?" Someone answered yes. This is false. This model does not have built in WiFi calling.

That said, I had this phone a couple years ago. It was fantastic. Be aware though, that these phones have been sitting on a shelf for a long time. The battery only lasts a couple hours, even though you've turned off programs running in the background.

Buyer beware.

title: Love It!
text: This is so super cool. I love the ring grips and this design is "IT". Very Happy.

title: So far, so good
text:
I don't know what the other reviewer was complaining about "poor quality." This is tempered GLASS. So it can break. Don't try to bend it as it will crack.

I dread putting on screen protectors. I followed the instructions on the product's Amazon page (it's one of the product images at the top of the page on the left). They didn't say anything except use what is provided. This is the order that I cleaned it:

1. The Wet Wipe (Marked #1 on it's packaging)
2. The Dry Wipe (Marked #2 on it's packaging)
3. I used the dust absorber

Then, I pealed the thin clear film off the tempered glass using the red tab that's connected to it.

I then turned over the side of the glass that the film pealed off from to face downward towards the watch.

I aligned it as best as I could and then placed it on the watch and carefully pressed it down. It has no bubbles. It's aligned with the watch face. I have no complaints. :-)

Looks nice, too.

Plus, if you make a mistake or if the tempered glass screen protector needs to be replaced for whatever reason, you have 2 more screen protectors.

If I have any reason going forward to not like this protector, I will update this review. For now, it went on easy and looks great. 5 stars!

title: Lightweight and many, many happy customers.
text:
I bought one of these for myself. One day, my husband asked if I had a power bank because his car lighter broke. Being a Lyft driver, customers commonly ask for a charge during the ride. I gave him the one I bought and haven't seen it since. Works like a charm and it's always charging someone's phone battery throughout the day. He comes home at night and recharges the power bank for the next day's rides and repeats this day after day after day. Talk about heavy usage and it's still going strong.

Then, I bought this for my parents as my father wasn't remembering to charge the phone before he left the house and my mother was upset because she couldn't reach him frequently because his cell phone had no power. I bought the mother-of-pearl-like white one and does my mother love it! She even has her cell phone plugged into it when she plays her card games on her cell phone and my Dad always leaves the house with his cell phone plugged in when he forgot to charge his phone. Very happy customers.

title: Solves charging my Galaxy Tab S2 problem and now an S7 Edge problem!
text:
I don't know if any of you have a Samsung Galaxy Tab S2. It has a finicky usb power port. It will only work with the Samsung plug and cable it came with and Samsung will not issue me a new cable as it is fraying (my only one to every fray!) I bought this 5-port Anker wall charger a while ago for a trip because it has 2 QC ports and it's the only one with more than one. I finally decided to try this charger with a lightening charging cable to test to see if I can charge my S2 tablet and OMG it works! Phew! You have no idea how many cables and Samsung and non-Samsung USB plugs I have swapped out trying to get the charge at its normal rate and these cables and plugs are in perfect working order, but the S2 always shows up saying it is charging too slow. Finally resolved! Thanks Anker!

Now onto my S7 Edge. It had been charging lightening fast for the full year I have owned it. Last week, was helping to troubleshoot an older USB multiport charger that is starting to fail at my parents house. Ever since then, my S7 Edge is charging at 1/3 the rate (using battery monitoring apps for years, so I know what I am talking about). Got it home and the problem persisted (Yikes!). 4 hours of charge gave a mere 25% increase! This is not good.

Looked online for an answer. Found one that said that this mostly fixes the problem. Ok. So I tried it. Disabled the Fast Charging in System Settings and turned it back on to connect to my Samsung plug and cable. Still, no good. Turned it back off and shutdown the phone. Brought it over to this Anker 5-port charger and attached it to a lightening cable I own and powered up my phone. Turned the fast charge setting back on. Blammo! It 20 minutes I have 40% increase. So relieved as what I found online had people turning in their S7 phones as they couldn't resolve their problem.

Curious, I brought it back to my Samsung plug and cable. It went to 1/3rd the speed again. Sigh. Not sure why. Brought it back to this Anker charger and I'm in business again. It's almost as if the original connection to the bad (non-Anker) multiport charger caused a problem in my S7 Edge that I then transferred to the Samsung wall plug and cable? Sounds soooo crazy, I know. Not enough data points to say this is it, but it is sure acting like it. Just happy I got things working and I am back to buy another one of these :-)

title: Mounting a smart phone? Heck no! Think bigger!
text:
I can't believe this worked! This magnet is fairly huge compared to the one I had for my Galaxy S5 from a different vendor. When I got my S7 edge, the my previous magnetic CD mount could barely hold it in place. I bought this one for my mother not realizing the magnet is so much larger. She later decided she didn't want to use it and gave it back to me. Since I had an extra one that looked stronger than my old one, I would give the S7 edge a try.

It holds the S7 edge without a problem. Then, I was planning on driving over 2000 miles for an upcoming trip. I was considering at the time if I could get the Waze app to display on my 9.7" Galaxy Tab S2. I dismissed it because I shouldn't be holding something like that while driving and I didn't think there was a mount available for it since it was so large.

It then occurred to me to try the tablet on this magnetic mount. It worked! Don't put the metal plate in the center of the tablet. Put it about 1/2" to an inch lower from where you would place it using the original center of the tablet (lower from the perspective of the orientation of the tablet on the mount). I have driven over 2000 miles with my tablet and a huge Waze navigation display. Yes, Waze does show more road with larger displays in the 3-D view (I don't know about the 2-D view).

Did the tablet mount with its case on? Yes. My tablet has an Otterbox case. The outer silicone case is too heavy for this too work. It does work with the thinner inner plastic case on such that I'm still using its screen protector. I don't mind the little bouncing it does while mounted like this as it didn't fall the whole time. It turns out that keeping the inner Otterbox case on was a good idea because with all the packing and unpacking of my car, the screen got scratched, but only the Otterbox protective screen scratched. The tablet's screen is just fine. If you do have concerns about the weight of the tablet on the mount and you don't think you will scratch the screen, then place the metal plate directly onto the back of the tablet. This will also be lighter and bounce less than mine did.

One thing to note: This magnetic CD mount barely fits into the CD player because it is too wide, unlike my old magnetic CD mount which fit perfectly. The CD player I used is only for my old navigation CD's (I don't use my car's built in navigation system anymore so this CD slot is useless). If this slot was for the music CD's, I am positive it wouldn't be practical. It is so hard to get in and I can see that the CD slot's soft material where you insert the CD is damaged. This definitely wouldn't hold up to being inserted over and over again.

title: I didn't get it, so I don't use it
text: I never got this idea of how this works. How can I angle it against the vertical face of my dash? I didn't return it though. I used the metal plates in it to attach to my tablet so that I could use it with a magnetic CD mount. So, um, thanks for the additional plates?

title: Got a satisfied customer here!
text:
With all the fake reviews out on Amazon for every case they have, I thought I would help with this one and give a real review.

I got this case for my mother as part of the Galaxy S7 gift that I gave her on Christmas. I let her pick out her case. This does not come with a screen protector and I knew that. Just thought I'd make it clear to others. My mother is what I call a low impact user. She is never walking and doing other things while using it. As such, she doesn't bobble the phone and has never needed it to protect her S7 from a fall. I hope that continues. Not because this case isn't good, but because no case will protect the screen completely. I see people complaining about this over and over again. If you think about the physics of how the phone can hit things on the way down or when it hits the ground (e.g. pebbles and rocks), you would realize it's impossible, too.

I will say though, my mother get's lots of complements on this case which makes her pretty happy.

title: Watched it die
text:
Everything with this was actually working for quite some time. I needed this for my tablet that I didn't want crashing to the ground anymore just because it was tethered to the wall socket. This did serve that purpose. If I accidentally walked into it, my tablet stayed put and the cord disconnected. I also bought it to save the life of the USB port on my tablet that I feared was dying. It did serve the purpose of reducing wear on the USB port, but eventually the mother board died and I got it replaced under warranty from Samsung.

Using a battery app that logs the charging rate every 5 seconds, I was able to confirm that it was charging at a quick charge rate. Using that same app, I watched it slowly die, too, until it no longer transferred a charge to my tablet. I returned it within the return time frame window around the holidays and that was about 2 months long. In other words, it took longer than a month for this to fail even though I still within my return window, most other times of the year, I would not be in it.

title: I truly wanted to make this work.
text:
I tried to make this product work for me. I am not going to be using the phone underwater at all, but I wanted this case because the "shockproof" feature really seems to be well thought out and to a degree, it is. I tend to drop my phones because I am doing too many things at once and lose my awareness of where the phone is when this happens.

As far as it's ability to protect the phone from me, I'm happy with the protection. Let's face the sad reality. It is hard to protect the screen of any "edge" smartphone. I do expect protection as long as the fall doesn't cause the screen to be directly hit. Having said that, here's the phone's pros:

- It is waterproof. I did the water test per the manufacturer's instructions and the case was waterproof as advertised.
- The case surrounds the phone's edges and it's slightly raised edge protects the screen from scratches. I have a lot of experience using the shockproof cases (e.g., Ballistic Tough Jacket, Otterbox Defender, etc.) and feel qualified to say that overall, this case does protect the phone well, although I am not going to try to drop this on hard surfaces like cement. I'm not that daring.
- The covers on all the ports are dustproof, too. The ports are well-protected.
- The buttons are fully functional as long as you follow the installation instructions carefully. Retry if at first you don't succeed, which is what I had to do. Short cutting the installation instructions on this phone will lead to the phone failing to respond to the user while in this case. The only area that I ended up having a lackluster response was in the upper right corner where drop down menus can be found sometimes, like on my app manager, which I use a lot (the drop down menu, I mean).
- When installed correctly, the edges of my phone where fully functional.

The first time I put the phone in the case, I wasn't using a hard surface to facilitate pressing the phone down into the front of the case well. Then the back of the case is pressed onto the front part, but without a hard surface to press down into, the case doesn't seal well in comparison to when the hard surface is used. Not doing this was the biggest problem I had and you will know you failed when you can feel the clear plastic screen protector not lying against the screen as you use the interactive area of the phone while in this case. When you install it well, there is no space and you feel like you are touching the screen (albeit, the gorilla screen's wonderful tactile properties cannot really be perfectly reproduced with any screen protector, imho).

I have 2 cons for this case and one I cannot see past:

- The screen protector has a mirror-like shine to it and it's far too glossy to use outside. It's almost winter and the sun is at low angles in the sky most of the day and I live only in mid-latitudes. When I'm driving using my navigation app, sometimes the phone is in the direct path of the sunlight and it obliterates my view of the screen. I drive a lot, especially on highways. During this time of year, as I head north, the sun is almost always hitting the screen and I simply can't see a thing, regardless of the brightness setting of my screen. This is the one deal breaker as the manufacturer should have used some sort of glare protection on this screen.
- Sound is reduced to poor quality. You have to always open the flap to have access to the microphone on the bottom and even when I do this, the people I'm talking to on the phone say my voice is somewhat muffled. Not a lot, just enough to be irritating to a few people, though. Similarly, the speakers, both internal and external are distorted. I am not an audiophile at all and even I can tell the difference. Worse, the callers are experiencing an "echo" which is well documented in these reviews. The manufacturer claims that this can be overcome, but there are too many show stopping problems in the sound category for me to want to put that effort in.

Who is this phone good for?

- People that dive or are in an area where dust is a constant problem. I would even go to say this is a great case for the beach. If you press the home button twice, the stock camera app opens up and you can easily take pictures without touching the screen, which is useful when taking underwater pictures.

I love the beach, but once there, I'd probably only want to use this case while on the sand and take it off at all other times. I don't like the idea of taking this on and off all the time, though. I have had my other phones at the beach on numerous occasions. For my use of each of my phones there, I've never had a sand problem. I'm not going to use it underwater and I don't live in a dusty area. With the screen reflection being blinding, which wouldn't be an issue underwater, this isn't the phone for me.

title: Yet another buyer beware concern
text:
According to the website fakespot, almost 100% of the Amazon reviews for this product have "high deception" involved. You can tell by the handful of 1 star reviews that this product has serious problems.

All I want is a case and screen protector that will protect my S7 edge with a screen protector that provides 100% of the s7 edge screen's functionality. What I don't need is to be tricked into some poor quality product that will result in a catastrophic failure most of the time if I drop my phone. These phone's are getting too expensive to incur such a loss. While they can never provide 100% assurance that the phone won't be destroyed, expecting the phone to survive the most common types of drops is not too much to ask.

title: Best car smartphone car mount I ever owned!
text:
Let me first say that I have bought car mounts of different types in the past, but this is the only one that really worked for me. Quite honestly, I love this thing. My car is old enough that I still have a CD player and as a bonus, I have an additional "navigation" CD slot that's separate from my CD player that is for my outdated navigation CDs to use with the car's outdated navigation system. Since the navigation CD slot is not in use and it's perfectly located high up on the dash, this was a good decision just from a "where to locate the smartphone car mount" perspective.

I chose to put the metal plate on the outside of my ballistic jacket case. They aren't manufactured anymore, but they were way better than the otterbox (only comparing this to give people an idea of the metal plate placement for this car mount) and perhaps that's why putting the plate on the inside of the phone's case or on the outside of the phone's case (not the ballistic jacket case itself) just didn't create a strong connection to the magnet.

Putting the magnetic plate on the outside of the ballistic case has caused absolutely no problems with my handling of my phone during normal use when the phone is off of the car mount. It is a thin metal plate that does not add to the form factor thickness of the case. People who are having trouble getting a strong magnetic connection may consider doing this. One thing of note, I put this on during the hot summer months. About 3 weeks later, the glue failed and the phone dropped off the mount with the metal plate being attached to the magnet on the car mount, instead of remaining glued to the case. Since I was satisfied with the overall function of the magnetic connection to the mount, I simply put superglue on the the metal plate and it has been perfect ever since.

I did have the experience to position the magnetic mount such that the phone was perfectly vertical. When you hit those bad potholes (I do try to avoid them for the sake of my car's suspension, but sometimes you simply can't avoid them or they sneak up on you), the phone would dislodge from the mount due to the jolt. The solution is simple and that's to angle the magnetic mount such that the phone is on a little bit of the slant so that the vertical force of the vehicle's jolt on the mount has some horizontal opposing force upwards against the vertical downward jolt. Works perfectly.

My phone has incurred absolutely no negative effects as a result of it's proximity to the magnet mount point. For those who are saying the magnet isn't strong enough, I would suggest purchasing a stronger magnet and placing it on the already magnetized mount. Problem solved. I didn't have to do this, but instead of throwing your money away on a perfectly good car mount, simply drop a few cents to remedy your magnetic connection if moving the metal plate to the outside of the case still doesn't work for you (after all, some phones or some phones + their case can be pretty heavy and you may need a little more of a boost, although my Samsung S5 phone with it's ballistc case and a bit of a tilt of the mount is all I needed to establish a sufficiently strong magnetic connection).

I'm glad I took the chance on buying one more car mount. This time, it was definitely worth it!

title: Works just fine if you are paying attention
text: I wasn't paying attention when I connected this to my device and I'm lucky I didn't damage it. I plugged in right justified. This is a data and charger cable, so it gets plugged in left justified. Everything worked just fine after that.

title: This thing really works!!!
text:
I just received the charger. I opened the box it was shipped in, then removed the Intocircuit from it's outer product box and I could tell a light was on. I was handling it carefully because I didn't want to drop and break this thing, so I know I didn't turn on any lights. It was the LED flashlight!!!! LOL. The device still had 19% charge. Never had a product delivered that was literally working before I even touched it!

I would say this product is off to a good start.

title: Buyer BEWARE: The cable only choice really is Samsung's. The other one is an OEM cable with car adapter, big difference
text:
Luckily, I bought the authentic Samsung data/charging cable. OEM's for cell phones, at least for me, have mostly not performed up to expectations, so I am glad I didn't buy the other product (OEM cable with car adapter).

I put a USB Power meter to test the true output power of this cable. It's up to specs, for sure. The cable is a true Samsung Micro-USB 3.0 charger/data cable.

title: UPDATED: 2017/07/11... UPDATING my UPDATE (originally was: The only case out there that continues to get great reviews and...)
text:
UPDATE: 2017/07/11 (Prime Day, 2017):

I came across this old review and what is old never got old. What I mean is, it has been 3 years since I bought these cases and my personal phone is still same S5 in the same Ballistic Jacket Case (this one, in fact!) I am telling no lie here. This is the best darned case EVER. I remain uncoordinated and still am dropping my phone all the time and my phone has NEVER flaked out. I keep the OS running smoothly and efficiently (which is why I have yet to replace it and let me tell you, I have loaded it up with apps and still keep adding apps!). I have had no reason to spend any money on a replacement phone and I know that if I ever have to upgrade the phone, I will be seeking out another Ballistic Jacket Case!

I had another amazing drop like I did years ago and in the same way, but worse. As it was dropping, I chased after it with my hand again and instead of catching the phone, I slammed my hand on it which then slammed, not dropped, the phone onto concrete. It slammed so hard that the phone bounced around more times than I ever saw it bounce!! This just happened a few months ago. So the case is like 3 years old now and not a scratch on the phone from the falls it has taken. Literally, the case is still looking pretty darn good, too!

UPDATE: 2015/02/20

These cases are the cat's meow for sure. I can't tell you how many times I've bobbled my phone with the Ballistic Tough Jacket case on it only to have failed to catch it and then have to watch the phone bounce around on the floor or ground till it stops. Every time, not a single thing is wrong with my phone or the case. The funniest one, as I am a bit clumsy, was when the phone started to drop from between my ear and shoulder while I was on the phone. As it was falling down my arm, I started trying to catch it (i.e., I was bobbling it). Then somehow, in one of my attempts to catch it, the back of my hand slammed, in a downward motion, the top of the phone and it landed on the ground so hard it was like I spiked the phone (like spiking a football). I watched in horror as it slams into the ground and bounces all around till it came to a rest. This time because of the impact, I'm afraid to see what I did to it. I picked it up very gingerly and inspected everything. To my utter relief, there was absolutely nothing wrong with it and the call I was on was still connected.

This was is my 2nd purchase of 3 of these cases. Apparently, I like them a lot! ;-)

Easy to put on and take off and the rubber bumpers, raised corners, and even rubber backing on the hard shell. I've already dropped the phone that this particular case is protecting and there's not a scratch on the phone or the Ballistic case and the phone continues to operate without a problem. It doesn't come with a screen protector, though. I bought the tempered glass screen protector from Luvvitt (sold here on Amazon) and this screen protect and the Ballistic Tough Jacket case are a great match. Highly recommend both.

title: Repeating being a repeat buyer for the Ballistic Tough Jacket for the Samsung S5
text:
I swear I am not trying to compete for most ballistic cases bought for the S5. LOL. Besides other's here have been devoted customers for years, I just heard about it about 2 months ago. So, yes, I am a newbie. I have a work S5 and a personal use S5 and now I just bought my husband an S5 for our anniversary and he asked me to get all the phone protection accessories that I have. So a 3rd Ballistic Tough Jacket for my husband it is.

These cases are well thought out without the excess bulk. I already dropped my first S5 and thank goodness for that Ballistic Tough Jacket. Not a single problem after the drop. It actually bounced, too. That phone continues to work and it's case remains in great condition. I could not be happier.

By the way, only the Maxx has a protective cover for the screen and comes with a belt clip that I do not want. It was clear to me that I needed a really strong screen protector, not the plastic film type and I came across the [[ASIN:B00IKRHCCY LUVVITT® Samsung Galaxy S5 TEMPERED GLASS Screen Protector for Samsung Galaxy S5 - Crystal Clear]] and I'm loving it. Just be careful on your purchase. Luvvitt says that their tempered glass for the S5 Active does not fit the standard S5. I don't have the S5 Active, so the link above is for the standard S5.

With Amazon having a great price on the Ballistic jacket than the manufacturer's web site, that gave me wiggle room to buy the Luvvitt Tempered Glass. Together they make the perfect pair for protecting the S5 and purchased together, they are the same price of the Ballistic jacket on the manufacturer's website.

title: Go Ballistic
text:
This case is refreshingly easy to put on. It is not as complicated as the OtterBox. I have returned my OtterBox for this case based on reviews for the Ballistic case on both on Amazon and the manufacturers site. If they are true, this should be a pretty impressive case.

No features of the S5 have been hampered by this case. Hearing clarity remains above average and no problems with the fingerprint scanner. It's raised and reinforced corner bumpers and extra cushion on the back of the hard case (don't forget there's already an inner jacket) adds to extra shock absorption.

This did not come with a screen protector and I didn't want the bulkier Tough Jacket Maxx which has both the screen protector and a belt clip. Since this case is about 1/2 the price on Amazon than on the manufacturer's site, I decided to get a really good screen protector for this really good case. I chose the "LUVVITT® TEMPERED GLASS Screen Protector for Samsung Galaxy S5 - Crystal Clear" on Amazon, too. Together, I think the two products make a great pair and the total cost for the 2 is about the same price as the Tough Jacket on the manufacturer's web site.

Overall I think this is a well protected S5.
